Posts.Content: palaminoridesagain wrote: For the last two weeks I have felt so good.  Like my old self, strong and running around like nothing was wrong.  It was wonderful.  Then it just happens.  The pain, the fatigue, the reality that I am stage 4 and not responding to treatment.  The disappointments yet determination that just makes me want to scream.  And then cry... Nicki Imagine the freedom of riding a Palamino bareback. Freedom of spirt and heart. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does this ever happen to you? palaminoridesagain jeanne46

Posts.Content: palaminoridesagain wrote: I have been fighting this battle for 7 years.  My last tumor markers went up.  I have mets to my femur, pleura and brain.  I just want to stop.  The chemo is keeping me alive but there is no quality life.  My Onc wants to put me on Navalabane, I'm already on Herceptin and Tykerb.  Just wondering if anyone feels this way and what would you do? Chemosabi Imagine the freedom of riding a Palamino bareback. Freedom of spirt and heart. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Do you ever just want to stop? palaminoridesagain Bren-2007

Posts.Content: palaminoridesagain wrote: Yep, I have been dealing with this new diagnosis for about 2 weeks now.  Have finished 9 out of 10 WBR.  Came as quite a surprise as I really didn't have any symptoms.  I was recently discharged from the hospital and still waiting for a new treatment plan.  All chemo is on hold during radiation.  I can't believe it's me NNN, aka chemosabi with brain mets.  A new venture in my life thats for sure.  Imagine the freedom of riding a Palamino bareback. Freedom of spirt and heart. Log in to post a reply
